My biggest worry was that it would cook the sushi inside. However, it did not! The inside is filled with crab, spicy tuna, tempura shrimp and this is all covered with avocado and shrimp. To top it off is some zesty spicy red sauce that is reminiscent of eating something smoked or barbecued. Combining a smoky flavor with sushi is uncommon yet ingenious! I may just love it even more than my past favorite, the cilantro inspired jalepeno Jose roll, which is also written on the wall among specialties.

I also always order the "sweet shrimp" amaebi nigiri. As I keep posting pics, the raw shrimp adorned with roe and chives gently cradle a martini glass with a festive cocktail umbrella. The fried shrimp heads are cooked to a crisp so it's similar to eating a soft shell crab, in other words - yes you eat everything! Yes, from the description, it's for more adventurous foodies, but it has earned its way into my heart as one of my favorite treats. It's not always prepared at all sushi restaurants. 

The art of sushi is definitely still alive here if you know what to order and are more daring. Their specialty rolls on the wall are far more impressive than their simpler traditional ones you'd recognize. Oh, and again, don't forget to ask for the fresh wasabi, the real deal, not some green play dough looking paste. I think it's a bit extra, but you'll thank me!

Let me warn you, this review has some bias. Ever since I started working in Surprise, which was around 2009, I've been eating here for lunch probably once a week. As a result, being a regular, I've had great service most of the time...except on super busy days (in which case only one waitress can handle so many tables at a time). I don't usually have to order because she already knows what I want, which is typically the sushi bento box. It comes with a salad, miso soup, choice of 8 piece Cali or spicy tuna roll, edamame, salmon/shrimp/tuna/white fish nigiri, veggie tempura and of course rice. It's like a sampler of fun for my tummy if you ask me. I always love bento boxes. 

The seafood here has been consistently fresh all these years. The rolls aren't exactly break-thru, but they all taste really good.

If I'm not eating bentos, might I recommend the following:

Monkey Brain Appetizer - Spicy tuna stuffed mushrooms and deep fried and covered in a sweet sauce. This one is a no-brainer. (Pun intended) 

Climax Roll - shrimp tempura, cream cheese, covered with spicy tuna and sliced jalapeño, tobkio, spicy mayo and eel sauce and creamy wasabi sauce

Second climax - same as above BUT spicy tuna covered in yellow tail (instead of shrimp and cream cheese inside)

Guilty pleasure - same as above BUT spicy tuna covered in Hawaiian white tuna 

Playboy Roll - shrimp tempura, cream cheese, avocado all inside and tuna, Panko crunchy flakes, eel sauce, tobiko, wasabi mayo outside

First Love Roll - Spicy crab with tuna inside. Fresh salmon and lemon slices outside with a sauce on top. 

Dynamite Roll - Baked goodness. Crab mix, scallops, shrimp, mushrooms all on top of a California roll baked with a sauce on top (every sushi restaurant seems to have this on their menu but each have their own variation. Here, it appears to be the added mushrooms).
Pretty regular spot for date night or  just grabbing a quick dinner.  Still haven't had anything I didn't like and the sushi is always fresh. Great customer service!!!

Been here a few times. Great food. Service ok.
But I just tried eating here. Showed up at 8:15 completely unaware that they closed at 8:30.
5 secs through the door, and the waiter lady gasped and says "you didn't see the sign, we're gonna close" rolled her eyes, and walked off completely overwhelmed...I would've gladly left understanding her situation, but she completely rubbed us wrong, went about it horribly, and we were out the door before she could return to serve her annoying customers...
Not a good experience whatsoever.

Sadly disappointed.  I am very familiar with japanese cuisine, and I went to this location because I liked the location in Surprise (there arent any japanese choices in Surprise and Hayashi sucks bad!) 

Anyways, the sushi I ordered was pretty bland, the fried rice i ordered was small.. I went in for lunch by myself and for 2 rolls of sushi and fried rice and a drink my total was $30 !!!  

I honestly have never felt so ripped off eating somewhere.  

Sakana has these guys beat, the lunch special sushi from them so much food that you wont finish it.  I have gone there with 2 people and both ordered the special, 2 drinks and fried rice and the total is under $29.
Amazing! Super quick service, and super amazing food. Would definitely recommend to anyone craving good sushi.
Sushi was great! Nice selection, really nice atmosphere and very polite customer service.

Food was excellent, however the service left much to be desired. Waited about 45 min before we had food on the table, and even then one meal was completely forgot. There is another sushi place nearby that I'll try instead.
The fish was fresh and the special rolls creatively made. Prices were reasonable especially the all day $5 Sake bombs.

Just moved to the area and thought I would try this place out instead of my usual Japanese express place I love so dearly. Once I walked in I thought wow this place was nice.... well that did not last long they took forever to ask for my to go order oh and they are so over priced  . It was not as good and I spent more for it. I was waiting for my to go order and a women walked in and sat down was was served all her food before mine which was not fair I had been waiting for a good 10 min before she even walked through the door. Not only that but I was charged more for a to go order because they include gratuity which is ok but they also ask for a tip too. All in all I find this place money hungry with poor customer service and mediocre food. I will not be going back to even give them another try.

I'm glad I gave this place a second chance... My first experience several months ago was very average... Decided to give it another chance last night... Very impressed. Loved the 'Second Climax Roll' -  Will be back for more...

I have eaten at Fresh Wasabi 4x now. I have to say that their rolls are very good, great quality. So if you're looking for sushi and/or rolls - it's great!  Also great is the hamachi kama appetizer - love it and get it every time. If you're looking for good teriyaki bento boxes - imo this is not the place. Also the crab puffs are clearly store bought and not in a good way. So, stick to their specialties and it's a go for Fresh Wasabi!

Was very impressed! The outside does not look like much but the inside was very clean and cute. I had a couple different Rolls and both were super fresh and tasty. My fiancé does not eat sushi and had a beef teriyaki and again was surprised was great. If looking for a great sushi place in surprise this place is great.

Friday night my wife and I found ourselves wondering what we would like to have when I suggested trying Fresh Wasabi.  

I had been here once before and I had the teriyaki chicken dinner and a caterpillar roll.  I wasn't impressed with the caterpillar roll at the time because the Eal tasted a little fishy.  since they had just opened I figured I would come back another day to make a comprehensive review of things. 

Wednesday night my wife and I ordered an array of items.  We got a tootsie roll, surprise roll, masago, sunshine roll, oysters, shrimp tempura roll and a couple others. 

The surprise roll was amazing, mouthwatering and full of flavor.  It was my favorite out off all the rolls.  The tootsie roll If I remember correctly had Eal layered on top and again the Eal tasted fishy.  As my wife and I were talking about it we came to the conclusion that maybe it just isn't cooked as well done as it is at other sushi bars.  Usually you will see the sushi chef put Eal on a piece of aluminum foil and pop it in a toaster oven before applying it to a roll but I don't think they do that here.

The Sunshine roll was a pleasant surprise.  Some one sitting at a table had ordered it not realizing it came with Masago on top and they sent it back and the waitress asked if we would like to have it so it didn't go to waist.  I was more than willing to accept.  The fish was fresh, cold and flavorful.  The thin slices of lemon on top made for a sweet and tart flavor.  Mmmmmm!

Lastly I ordered there oysters that were on special since everyone at the bar was also ordering them and I didn't want to miss out on this tasty adventure.  They were prepared with a little fish sauce, masago, and hot sauce.  Wow they were tasty.

The shrimp tempura was also very good.  This is what I call my old stand by.  I love shrimp tempura so having it in a sushi roll is delectable.  

Every one at the sushi bar was a lot of fun, we all talked and shared laughs together.  The sushi chef was preparing excellent sushi, and the wait staff was very friendly and kept up with our drinks and were very tentative.  We will be back.  My only recommendation is that they maybe cooked the Eal a little longer or find another vendor for it because it is not mouth watering by any means.  So if you live in Surprise or are in the area go by and check out Fresh Wasabi, you wont be disappointed.

The new ownership has really made great improvements. Everything is very high quality and for what you get, the prices are very good. The happy hour and lunch specials are really good deals. All of the people who work here are very friendly. I will definitely return.

I have to say I was impressed.  I am not a fan of the big, over the top trendy sushi bars.  This place was just right.  The service was great.  I love when a service person takes the time to talk with you and give you as much information as you need.  The sushi chefs were authentic and actually care about what they make.  Now on to the food....  awesome!  There are way too many sushi places that pack a little fish into a one inch wrapping of rice.  This place was just the opposite.  An emphasis on taste, appearance and quality sets this place apart from the rest.  The sashimi was incredible.  It was very moist and dissolves in your mouth just like good raw sushi should.  And they of course offer "fresh wasabi".  Normally I am used to the standard green blob that everyone serves.  But for $1 you can get a great departure from the norm.  Just a little dab of fresh wasabi on some tuna sashimi and you will know a difference.

I can definitely say that I have found a new sushi spot.  Others very close by have tried and failed due to an attempt to be a "Scottsdale" sushi bar.  This is a much more authentic sushi place with a great simple decor and true service.  You will find it hard to be disappointed.

A local spot recommended by a friend. Sushi was great. I'm a fan of "The Little Mermaid" sushi dish. My husband likes this place and the coupon for buy $15 to spend $25 helped alot. It was almost like getting a free dish. Chicken fried rice is horrible and I wouldn't order anything else besides Sushi here.

I love this place! Everything is delicious! I love the eel and booty booty rolls! The husband loves the caterpillar roll. I usually come in for a light lunch when I'm through hiking. I always bring in my friends... sushi nubs or sushi haters just so I can get them to change or makeup their minds. LoL. Service is great and there is always seating.
I like to call and order a cali roll to go when I am busy running errands and shopping, it is inexpensive, they make a cool cali roll, and they are nice and fast.

Good selection of apps, salads, ramen and udon, sushi and sashimi at reasonable prices. No frills and average to above average flavors freshly made.

Had the veggie tempura (6 pieces mixed of onion, zucchini, sweet potato, and asparagus) with a sweet sesame sauce, small salad (chopped lettuce, red cabbage, carrot with simple soy and sesame dressing), and bowl of miso (very nice). Tempura and miso were very good, while the salad was just so-so. Not bad for $8.50. Wife enjoyed her California and Baked Lobster rolls.

Nice to have a quick and easy Japanese place in the area.

The service was exceptional tonight despite the fact one of the sous chef's did not show up for work...
To ease the pain of having to wait a few extra minutes we were served an order of Edamame.
CA Roll and Fried Rice were phenomenal.
Will definitely go back again.
Newton and the other Server did a marvelous job.

Went here today for lunch as soon as I walked in I was greeted by a friendly server, didn't catch her name and ordered the cali roll. I asked if they can make the crab spicy, and the chef did it and OMG was so yummy. I don't really like cali rolls but these were so simple and flavorful and FRESH! What I like most about the sushi was the filling, so much, and not a lot of clunky rice. can't wait to go back again!

I went here with a friend the other night for dinner.  The Service was good, the space was clean.  The average Roll Price ranges from $5 to $8  with some special rolls costing a bit more.  We split about 4 Rolls and each had a Kirin. The California Crunch rolls were tasty, the spicy Crab was a big hit with my friend, and the Crunchy Tempura Shrimp with eel sauce was my favorite.  

We also tried one of their many special rolls, we went for the "Booty Booty Roll" not just for the name but because it seemed to have a complex flavor profile.  based on our personal tastes, we didn't find the  Booty Booty Roll to be 

"Rockin Everywhere"

but it was good, just maybe too many flavors at once, I would probably go for something simpler next time.  I also saw some of the other food coming out of the kitchen and it looked good, and being that the thought of raw fish would disgust my wife I know she'd be able to find something to eat too.

I plan to come back soon.

This is my go to sushi spot! After moving here recently we tried every place within a 15 mile radius and this is hands down the best. Service is amazing...they are happy to serve you. The owner and his wife are the sweetest- shes also the greatest server. Did I mention the bathroom is so clean that I could eat in it?  Quality fish, products, and you cannot beat their lunch special. Blows Uni Sushi down the street out of the darn water. Try the salmon!!!

Had the bulgogi bowl and it was pretty darn good. Vegetables were fresh, meat was flavorful and tender, and rice was well done. 

This is the type of local place that deserves your business.

FIRST LOVE ROLL!!! Best roll ever. I've had a lot of sushi but this roll is the perfect balance of taste. You'd think "eew, lemon on a sushi roll, no thanks" but in fact it is the best thing that will ever happen to you. I've since moved from Arizona but still think about this roll.

The only thing going for this place is the lemon roll.  Its dark and dingy, poor servers  who don't know the menu and when they make mistakes MULTIPLE times they're rude to you. We asked for the salmon ROE 3 times and the server said that's not salmon roll  ( we asked for ROE) every times she brought out some random roll.  Even after we pointed to the menu with the picture she continued to bring the wrong thing.  On that note  when we finally got " salmon ROE " it was definitely sturgeon Roe not salmon Roe.  We also got the Japanese dumpling soup which turned out to be potstickers in ramen broth with alot of cabbage for $12. Our son had the teriyaki plate as there's no kids menu but he said it was good.

Went there for the first time a couple weeks ago.  When I go for sushi, it pretty much consists of Nigiri Tuna and California rolls, I'm not a hardcore sushi eater by any sorts.

Service was good, was seated right away, took my drink order, came out.. My drink never got empty before a replacement came out (big plus for me).  I ordered one of their sushi meal things and requested it all be tuna (you get to pick), GF orders something, I think it was Teryaki beef..

Couple minutes goes by, another lady comes out and tells me I cant have all Tuna cause its too expensive.  Hey.. I'm an easy going guy, I shrug my shoulders and say, "cant you chuck another $5 on my bill to make up for it?".   I'm not sure what she said, but apparently that was ok :)

Food comes out, I had a bite of my GF's meal and the beef was cooked very nicely and the sauce was great!  My sushi was good, you cant really expect too much out of Tuna and California Rolls other then they just be fresh.

I noticed they have some nice Happy Hour stuff.  There was a flier floating around inside that said it was 2:30-4:30pm, looked like some good deals.  When I was leaving, the window said a different time for the Happy Hour special, no biggie.. I might go back and check it out

Atmosphere was good, staff was incredibly friendly/attentive! Food was tasteful and fulfilling! Sue! She was my waitress and was super!! I will definitely return! And will spread the word about this restaurant! I recommend this place 100%

Excellent sushi and very friendly staff, the husband and wife team running the place are great.  Any sushi place that has real wasabi is ok by me.  All of the rolls we had were great and the baked lobster roll was the best I have ever had.

First off... I come to sushi places for the Veggie rolls and appetizers. I don't do any of the rolls with fish... 

I had the veggie roll & the cucumber roll. My friend and I shared the gyoza which were great. My rolls were as expected.. and in my book that was good. My only complaint and its minor.. but I asked for the avacado to be swapped out with cream cheese.. she said there would be an extra charge for this....?? I decided to keep the avacado..  anyway, my friend had the california rolls and was pleased enough with them. 

So, for a small quaint little place.. It was good.

Seriously love this place. The sushi is awesome and the service is great. One of the best sushi bars I have been to. They have always taken care of me and whoever I bring in. No matter how much we spend they always throw in some extra here and there. I have been coming here for about 2 years this place will continue to be my only sushi spot when I'm home. Thank you for your great food and service Fresh Wasabi!!

My husband and I come here frequently. We have tried other sushi restaurants, but nothing even comes close to this place! My personal favorite is the Little Mermaid Roll and the Spicy Tuna Roll. My husband usually gets the Vegas Roll, Tootsie Roll and  tries something new for his third choice. Everything new we try we love, but still have our favorites! 

Overall this place has a really nice atmosphere. It's small and dimly lit which is good for us romantics :). It's usually pretty quiet so there's no need to shout like in busier restraints. The service has always been wonderful and we have never had any complaints. You will see the same two women serving consistently and you will love them.  

A complete list of our favorites:
The little mermaid roll
Spicy tuna or salmon (the crunch ones are good too)
Tootsie roll
Dynamite roll
Las Vegas roll
Godzilla roll

I come from Seattle, and we have LOTS of good sushi there. Went last night with my best friend who is visiting here from Seattle, and it was hands down the BEST sushi I've ever tasted anywhere.  The beef yakisoba noodles had the best spices/herbs we've both ever tried. 
My sushi was fantastic, I had the Booty Booty roll and the Four Seasons roll. I will go back and try every single other thing on the menu. Best part? I don't have to go allllll the way over to Snottsdale to find quality Japanese. Oh, and the portions are good. I could NOT finish the 2 rolls, brought the rest home.
Ok, we went again last night 5/29/2010, and we were all pleased as punch. My sis from sacto, who is a veteran Sushi lover, was in heaven. The 4 of us shared the Booty-Booty Roll, Catapillar Roll, Cherry Blossom roll, and Rainbow Roll. Also Shrimp Tempura, and grilled makarel. It was great, licked up every bite. 
I don't understand WHY my review is 'filtered' or held back from the other reviews? Have I offended someone somehow??

It was good! Fresh Wasabi is an inexpensive, small, and simple restaurant. If I wanted amazing sushi then I wouldnt have gone there - I would have spent a $100 at an expensive sushi bar. BUT I was craving eel sauce and ginger and plain old sushi and I was on a budget- It was delicious and didnt disappoint for the amount of money I was spending. I spent $50 for my family of 4(2 kids and 2 adults)! We left stuffed. That included appetizers, sides, and sushi- 5 rolls. the Climax roll was my favorite. I will come again for a quick sushi trip!

They kept my kids happy and our waters full!! Thanks again.

First, the servers are unfriendly which made an unpleasant experience in and of itself. Secondly, I ordered a ton of food and wanted to use the Yelp check in which they denied. Thirdly, the food was not great and gets worse every time I've eaten there.The avocado appetizer shrinks upon each visit. Lastly, my niece and I got brutally sick immediately after eating there. I do not recommend eating here.
Refused to honor the Yelp coupon and they were very rude about it. No explanation. The restaurant was totally deserted at dinner time. Not a good sign. We won't be going back.

Although the atmosphere is a little plain and has a lingering odor of their fish(from the sushi bar), it makes up for it with their food. The sushi was delicious and tasted fresh. I don't quite understand the 10% gratuity fee for take out when the prices are already a little high, but I do plan to come back and try more on the menu.

I love Japanese so I was very excited to try Fresh Wasabi Sushi & Grill.  Since it was girls day out we all planned to pay for our own lunch.  It was a nice surprise when we walked in, good decor and booths.  We had seen the menu on the outside of the restaurant so we knew we wanted to try... the Bento boxes.  We were planning to use our Yelp coupon but when the waitress saw our coupon she said we could not order the Bento Boxes and only one coupon per table.  We explained that we did not see that on the coupon.  She eventually came around and let us use two coupons and one of us was allowed to order the B.B.  The food was good and met my expectations for fresh sushi.  It was $16 for a large portion of sushi, soup & salad.  The salad was a little weak, maybe not fresh enough.  The soup was very tasty and the Bento Box was very generous and much to my friends liking.  I'll be back for sure.

Great local sushi spot! Love their Vegas Roll and Cherry Blossom Roll.  Staff is very friendly.  Always seem on top of refills.  Has kind of a mini sports bar feel with a couple of TVs but without all the loudness.  The prices are very reasonable as well.  I recommend this spot over the other one across the street.

Used to go here and enjoy.  Service/food/portions all were good.  Two months ago bought the restaurant.com 10 for $25.  Went last month.  Disaster:  food was still good.  The service was deplorable-clear down to arguing over her mistake on the use of the coupon.  Went again last night-used to the $10 for $25.  Now the food while good have been shrunk to ridiculous.  They should be ashamed to put it on the plate.  From the rolls to the shashimi (which you could read a kindle through).  Then it's time to check out (same rude waitress).  I look and sure enough same game.  When I complain this time though she suddenly remembers and proceeds to rant 4 different times that she took it on the chin last time for $7.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME?  You don't want people using coupons-don't put them out there-only to have them come in and then cheat them.   I have two more of these coupons and WILL NOT BOTHER to go back.  I do not expect them to be in business another 6 mos.
I have quite a few friends that I have turned on to this place and have become regulars there.  Will certainly tell them not to bother to go back.  If they saw the sashimi and roll shrinkage, they would be appalled.
The food here is pretty good, even though the customer service is poor.

Wow! I've been coming here for years under the old management and like it then. Now, wow! I love the uniqueness of all the food. Spicy and just delicious. I had the habanero salmon roll and it is now my favorite. If it's been awhile since you have come here, try it out! Very good food and like no other sushi I've had. Can't wait to come back.
First time here and love it. My 9-year-old daughter does not like sushi, but after she started tasting my sushi on my plate she now loves sushi.
New owners are sooo awesome! Their new menu has incredible options! The quality of sushi is so much better than previous owners! We tried 4 different rolls and loved them all!
Best sushi restaurant on the west side. The fish is always fresh and the hospitality is wonderful. We ABSOLUTELY love going to Fresh Wasabi for our family night out! Thank you

our favorites are the miso soup, mermaid and baked lobster roll! I take my kids here often, we love it!  The atmosphere is nice, the kids enjoy sitting and watching them make the rolls.  The lunch specials are very affordable the customer service is great.  very clean too!

Finally Surprise AZ has a great Sushi hangout...  Loved it. Owners are super friendly and the Sushi is amazing.  The baked dish took a little long to cook,  but was worth it.  The Spicy Scallop on the A La Carte menu was fabulous.

great value in yelp offer. just remember this is a business, in business. good fish costs bucks. respect it, folks. don't abuse it!
DESPITE THE LOCATION, THIS SUSHI SPOT IS LEGIT!

--great tako sunomono. tender and bittersweet. nice.
--miso soup spot on.
--salmon skin hand roll. ftw.

#veg tempura was crispy but not flakey.

squished in a corner of this impossible strip mall along the Bell Rd abyss of consumerism shopping hell, this jewel of a japanese eatery blesses the area with your favorites, prepared in proper japanese style.

can't wait for my next meal there!

This place gets FREE advertising by having a coupon in the Entertainment Book and then refuses to honor it. I would not even know it existed except for finding the location in the book. We live in central Phoenix and only come to Surprise every other month to pick up our granddaughters to spend the weekend. If we had gotten to try the place and liked the food and atmosphere, we might have come back again to eat dinner after dropping the girls off on a Sunday evening. It is the principle that is wrong here, and why we did not stay to eat after seeing the blatant notice on the front door that they will not honor the coupons. Bad business.

Treated ourselves to a late afternoon, pre-dinner crowd rush, Valentine's Day meal at Fresh Wasabi yesterday. Being a small operation, the ambiance has always been a bit austere, but we immediately noticed some new decor and wall hangings, very lovely! We also noticed that they made a distinct effort at romance for the day with fresh red roses on the tables, many of the staff wearing some red, and a fun display at the greeting station.

We were greeted warmly and happily by the owner and seated at our regular table. We tried the cherry blossom roll, baked lobster roll, and the bronze medal roll this time. All were phenomenal, but we cannot imagine ordering the baked lobster roll without the bronze medal roll at the same time, they were perfectly complimentary to one another!  We paired the cherry blossom with a couple pieces of yellow tail nigiri, very soft and tender with perfect flavor, and we were happy with the match.

As always, presentation was spot-on and the service was great! It was an unexpectedly fun Valentine's meal! Thanks!

Loved it! Many places don't give you that much fish and a lot of rice in their rolls, but the ratio of fish-to-rice was perfect! A great balance. Flavors were some of the best we've had in the valley. We recommend "Cherry Blossom". Definitely will be returning
Love this place! Food is great and the staff is always very nice. Food take a little bit to come out but other than that, sushi is really good!

I was REALLY hungry, so I called in three rolls to go. When I got home with them, I found them to be so small that it made me angry. For $35, I got a tiny appetizer. I've never seen rolls made so small. I had to call and have a pizza sent to my room for dinner. I eat sushi all the time.
prices paid didnt reflect to go prices. fresh but war from rice. enjoy the sushi from frys fore.

Haven't been here since it under new management.  Definitely looks better and cleaner.  I was put off by the hostess.  She welcomed us with a mouth full of ramen which she pointed out "sorry, I have a mouth full of ramen."  She then seated us and complimented my highlights in my hair, followed by "I'm too Mexican to dye my hair." What?! It was weird.  When they declined to use the gift card we'd received under previous management (not upset, I understand things happen) we decided to leave.  She was very unprofessional.  We might go back and try the new menu sometime, but hopefully she can gain some professionalism before then...

Alright, a brief disclaimer: this is not Scottsdale's Ra Sushi or Sushi a-Go-Go, what it IS is a small sushi business operated near a Walmart shopping center. That being said, I have been to this particular sushi bar multiple times and have NEVER been disappointed in their food or service. Restaurant is clean and modern; sushi rolls are tight and well-made, not overly decorated or doused with goopy sauces. Expect to pay ~$8 per "regular" roll (ie, spicy tuna, california) and $12+ for specialty rolls. Their rainbow roll here is to DIE for. Miso soup and side salads are NOT included with sushi order, nor are there very many "specials" or enticing happy hour menus. I hope to see that improve in the near future.

Came back here for the first time since they first opened and I did not review it the first time because it was a 2-3 star experience and I wanted to give it another try.  I can certainly understand why Jennifer and Jojo wrote a bad review for this place because the 67ave & Bell location gives this place very large shoes to fill.  The first time I came here the sushi was small and the taste was not memorable but when we came back yesterday the sushi was as good as the Bell road location.  We ordered some of our favorites like the "climax", "school bus", "spicy tuna lover" and one other I cant remember right now but it was good too.  I really like their specialty rolls here and on Tuesday's they have "by one get one half off".  We stuffed ourselves and had a few drinks.  They have some beer selections but they only have 2 alcohols (vodka & crown royal) so don't come here for the drinking, that is what Squid Ink is for.  The service was OK, and the atmosphere is very casual.  The whole room is about 30 by 30 in size with about 12-15 tables inside.  Nothing fancy but the sushi is worth coming here, I'm not a fan of Squid Ink unless I'm going over for drinks at a happy hour.
Sushi rolls were very good.  I would recommend the dynamite roll.  Only had one guy helping during dinner rush.  He hustled and did a good job.
Fresh Wasabi is under new Management! Kevin is back from way back when! Food and conversation was amazing last night! Best of luck Kevin!

We went here for the first time today and WOW!!!!!  Hubby had Beef Yakisoba (requested to be spicy), I had a Double Shrimp Roll (had shrimp inside + on top) and we shared a Loco Spicy Jack Roll (one of 3 specials listed which had jalapeño inside).  The sushi were SOOO tasty and the Yakisoba was SOOO authentic!!  This is the first time we have found Yakisoba that tastes like what you get in the small, local mom-and-pop restaurants in Japan.  I can't wait to come back!!!
Don't waste your time here. You're better off going to Fry's market and getting their pre-rolled sushi. Sushi rolls tasteless, small portions, no heart. Will not be returning.

Wow I am also surprised to see some of the reviews this place has received. My wife and I love to go to this location. The food is great, service is awesome and the prices are reasonable. Plus we like to hit their specials during happy hour. I hope more people check this place out, I know each visit I have made I have been very pleased.i have been to this location about 5 times and they have never let me down. Thanks!
Ordered to go, service and food was fast and delicious!  That climax roll is no joke!  Will eat from there again for sure.

Husband and I stopped by for a quick early dinner. We were the only patrons, which I don't mind. The hostess was very nice and explained the menus. I ordered the bulgogi bento box and husband ordered two yellowtail rolls. The sushi was out within five minutes, followed closely by the bento box. The bento box was much larger than expected and the variety of items was good. Husband said the yellowtail had good flavor, just wasn't as cold as he prefers. Overall, great super fast little restaurant!
My husband brought me take out Sushi (caliroll) it was pretty tasty!!! Yummy! I'm coming back!!

Good food, but overpriced.

I got a combo and it was $32.
also they charge 10% on to-go orders.

What? No thanks.  There is better sushi in the surprise/Peoria area for much less.

Mini history lesson:
"Sometimes in the 90s tipping was 10%-15%, it increased after 2000 to about 18%, eventually reaching 20% in some areas by 2010's.   Some generous people will push it even farther to 21-22%.  Tipping has never been required and is always on the customer whether they choose to or not."

But to make 10% mandatory on a to-go order before taxes, NO NO NO
Kabuki does To-go orders for free, and their boxes are beautiful and customized.

they don't charge for some leaky generic Styrofoam.

Decent sushi. The specials could be better priced. But the food was good and comfortable atmosphere. If you like to indulge in a few adult beverages, it looked like they had some good specials in that department, but I was unable to partake at the time.

This is a wonderful place to eat some really good sushi. I come here a few times a week with a variety of friends and all have loved it. The service had been awesome and specials are well within everybody's budget. Gotta try it!! Keep up the great stuff
First visit was great. I had chicken yakatori and edamame. The wife had sushi, which she loved. Very friendly staff.

Friendly staff.  Good sushi.  One of my favorites was the Guilty Pleasure Roll:  spicy tuna, covered with Hawaiian white tuna, jalapeno, garlic, tobiko, nuts, eel sauce, spicy mayo and creamy wasabi sauce.  

We asked if they could make us a spicy salmon roll since it wasn't on the menu, but they said they couldn't.  I find that really weird.  

Anywhoo, skip the cheesecake tempura and get the chocolate mochi.  It's yummy!
I don't eat sushi so I had the double crunch roll. My husband  sushi I think their food was amazing

Was headed towards a bad decision lunch at Panda Express until I decided I should really give this place a try. There wasn't a solid vegetarian choice for lunch so I opted for the Teriyaki Salmon. Order that - $10.95 and 15 minutes. Grab my bag and head back to the office. Open it up to see a chunk of salmon atop of pile of soggy cabbage, a lump of white rice, a small green salad, a scoop of potato salad, and a dumpling of some sort. There's a separate container with a few pieces of vegetable tempura. 

Salad was tasty but warm, potato salad was weird...there might have been cucumbers in there, the salmon was overcooked and dry, and I didn't eat the dumpling since it appeared to have chicken. The tempura was rather tasty but nothing extraordinary. 

I'd recommend they lose the potato salad, fill that space with the tempura, and put the green salad in the separate container. Hot green salads are a bummer on top of a "eh" meal.

I doubt I'll be back. Steamed vegetables and chow mein at Panda would have probably been a better choice...
These guys at fresh wasabi microwaved my hamaichi Kama - scary!!!! Go to Sushi Brokers in Scottsdale for consistent and fresh sushi. Sorry this place does not cut it for me. Sushi rice was vinegary!
Food is ok but more upset that they add 10 percent gratuity  to all takeout orders. That should be my choice. Not thrilled!
The sushi was ok, not the best I've ever had but just ok. I would LOVE to not be disappointed by AZ sushi, but my search goes on.
Fresh sushi and great service!! The food always comes out quickly. We love eating here! Best sushi restaurant in Surprise
Just like any other sushi place with a high pricing for the average quality

TASTY!!  Great food, nice friendly people, pleasant atmosphere.  The owner greets you coming in and checks on you during your meal.  They make you feel welcome and you can tell that lots of people return frequently.  Fresh fish and creative combinations that are served in eye pleasing arrangements.  Cherry Blossom Roll was beautiful and tasty! I grew up in Japan and love sushi so this place will always have a fond memory in my belly and taste buds.  Not big but comfortable surroundings.  Prices also are good and actually cheap compared to other sushi places I've been to.
Great sushi place! Definitely will come back again. Being from Seattle, I missed good sushi, so I'm excited we'd try it!!

First things first. This place needs to put some money into the restaurant. The chairs are damaged and mine had duct tape on it in an attempt to fix the upholstery. If they don't plan on updating, their prices are way too high. It's a dump, if you want to charge regular prices you need to upgrade. I ordered veggie rolls, so I can't speak on the quality or freshness of the fish. My rolls were "ok". They kept falling apart and the taste was fine, nothing special. The waitress was also rude. It's a place I would go to for a cheap happy hour, they don't have much else to offer.
Friendly waiters, efficient cooks, and good food. The seaweed salad is darn good and the sushi taste amazing. The sushi is fresh and flavorful.

I had my son's wedding dinner (small party) at Fresh Wasabi. We were greeted outside the restaurant by the owner. Our server was very sweet and attentive. The food was excellent as well. It's a very quaint family like atmosphere. My youngest son insists we go there and only there for sushi. He & I had dinner a there a couple weeks ago, nothing has changed. The excellent food and service were not a fluke. I am so excited I found this place in November. I plan on becoming one of their many regulars although I've only been there twice. I will have my son's 14th birthday dinner at Fresh Wasabi per his request. I highly recommend this place. I am a huge sushi fan, food and service like Fresh Wasabi provides is hard to find.

I've been here twice and loved it both times! I've tried several different basic rolls (yellow tail, tuna, Philadelphia) and loved them all. The rice used is great! Also tried salmon, tuna, and Hawaiian tuna nigiri and the fish is GREAT quality and really clean crisp flavors with everything! Both sushi chefs were friendly and fun to talk to and the waitress I had both times with the tattoos is super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. The first time I went and it was very busy but I still did not have a long wait for my food and it was a great atmosphere! The second time I went, hardly anyone was there and I had a great conversation with another customer and the sushi chef. Really good prices on food and drinks! I live in the neighborhood and will keep going back!

Sushi is average, I would way below average.
Pricing is slightly above average.
Portions are very small. I always order sushi with tuna, but since it is expensive, they give you tiny pieces, and bulk-up on the cheap stuff.

This is the only sushi restaurant my wife and I will eat at in the Phoenix area. We've tried Tomo's, Nakama and the horrible sushi place in WestGate, but Fresh Wasabi is the best. Everything is always fresh and delicious. We usually get the Alaska, Phoenix and Tootsie rolls. They offer a military discount, and one of the sushi chefs is ex-Army and likes to come out and greet fellow military personnel.
Already overpriced for small rolls, they now charge a 10% gratuity on takeout orders. I used to be a customer. I won't step foot in that place again. Greed.

The Las Vegas Roll for happy hour was AWESOME! We also had their Loco Roll. The Loco Roll was good. It reminded me of one of the rolls I get for a quick sushi fix at Fry's Foods. The place is very small. The windows are covered with a white sheet like material, held together with duct tape to give it a more darker ambiance. There was no one in the place at 3:30pm when me and my son went in, which was 03/18/2016, so I guess I was expecting decent service. That expectation flew out the window, after we were served our rolls. The entire staff, and I mean the two female servers and the two guys behind the counter decided it was time for them to eat, because we were forgotten about at that point. After we finished our rolls, which was about 8 minutes, I was expecting one of them,(and all 4 of them were about 20 feet away) to ask us if we wanted anything else. YES we did want more of those Vegas rolls! But after 10 minutes of waiting and still no service, I stood up and walked half way to their table as to "Not disturb" their lunch/dinner break while their only two paying customers were patronizing their establishment, waited in hand, with my credit card hoping to have them check us out so I could go to another restaurant and get my fill. It took them another 3 minutes for them to acknowledge me standing there. That being said, I will not go back, even though the Vegas Rolls ROCKED! The service and atmosphere leave a lot to be desired.

I will preface this review by saying that I am from Chicago (and still live there, mind you)... and am a regular sushi eater at some of the best sushi restaurants in a city that is known for, and loves, its food.

With that said, I have been to Fresh Wasabi twice now and... can state with confidence that Fresh Wasabi is some of the best sushi I have ever eaten!  Try the First Love specialty roll -- you will love it!  Have you tried it yet?  Seriously, what are you waiting for?  Ok, since you are still reading this, then let me give another recommendation -- try the Crunch Spicy Tuna.  You say it looks a little boring for your exquisite, developed taste buds?  Then tell them to add tobiko (they will do it with a smile).  Have you tried the rolls yet?  Go.  Eat.  Now!

What a horrible experience. We ordered the Shrimp Tempura Crunchy Roll and it tasted burnt. The Dynamite Roll tasted like hot mayonnaise and burnt mushrooms. The yellowtail sushi was dry and definitely not fresh. The albacore was pale, dry and completely unappetizing. And when our family of 5 walked out without even eating they didn't even ask if anything was wrong. If you love sushi, don't go here!

Tried this recently looking for some teriyaki.  This was disappointing.  It was not crisp, which I like, and I didn't care for dipping sauce, too bland.  It was a little high priced for what we got.  Will not go back for the teriyaki.
Great experience, they were nice, everything on the menu sounds delicious and everything that we got was amazing!

Ok maki, but everything else kinda sucked.  Went about 1 to have the lunch specials with my hubby.
The good: 
The rolls were great, like I said.
 The tempura, not bad.
The not-good:
Spicy tuna rolls were not tasty and a little warm.
Salad in the bento box was crap.
Edamame was not warm or appetizing.
Spicy chicken may not have been chicken and was not very spicy either.
My vote, skip it.
I just moved here from San Diego, this place is down the street from our new home it is DELICIOUS! YUMMMMMERS

My husband and I are fairly well versed in sushi restaurants.  This place is WAY overpriced and the food is subpar at best. They don't have a kids menu and they refused to make just a bowl of noodles for our 3 year old.  It took forever for service and then forever for our food.  The best tasting thing was the miso soup, bulgogi was bland, sushi was bland, calamari was overfried and just not good.  Service wasn't great either.  So overall we just spent $40 on a bland dinner and won't be coming back.  Sorely disappointed.

Under new ownership.  The miso soup was the best!  The mixed tempura appetizer was good, especially the shrimp. The Golden Avocado appetizer was really good. Will definitely come back again soon. Recommend!
Been here quite a few times seeing that it's the only real sushi place in Surprise. Good sushi/sashimi, good atmosphere (I love the little places), and quick service are what make this place great.

I tried this place since its the closest place to my home but I have to say I was disappointed with the quality and portion size of their sushi rolls for the cost. I much rather drive several miles to Nakama on McDowell Rd in Goodyear!

This place was great! We used the yelp deal and the check in special. We had 3 specialty rolls, an order of dumplings and an order of calamari and our bill was $17. ($15 for the yelp deal + $17 on the actual bill = $32.) We saved almost 50% and the food was fantastic. We will definitely return.

We used to frequent this restaurant, especially for carry out until the started adding a 10% surcharge on all carry out orders. I had forgotten about that when my daughter asked if we could pick up sushi for dinner. 

We ordered two regular rolls, a specialty roll and some nigiri for $78.95. Their prices have gone up significantly since we've eaten there and the fish quality has seriously diminished. My wife even said her nigiri didn't even feel like real fish. 

The male owner, though I didn't see him tonight, is very nice as are the young waitresses who I believe are his daughters. The one woman though who I believe is the co-owner is just plain rude. 

If they could go back to how it was when they first opened with reasonable prices and great sushi, I could recommend this place but not anymore.

Closed on Sundays.

This place has super friendly service.  I ordered the tonkatsu ramen and though it was good, the taste of bamboo shoots was strong.  The hubs had their spicy pork bento box and he enjoyed it very much.  

We've been here a few times and the menu and restaurant layout has changed almost every time we've been there.  Hope this place is here to stay though.
